article.headline: Sacred Heart 90, Yale 80
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- Jarrid Frye scored 17 points to lead Sacred Heart to a 90-80 win over Yale Monday night. The Pioneers (3-5) had six players in double figures and led by as many as 18 points. Joey Henley and Tavio Hobson each had 14 points, Liam Potter and Luke Granato scored 12 apiece and Ryan Litke finished with 11 for Sacred Heart. The Pioneers took command with a 12-2 second-half run that was capped by Chauncey Hardys steal and dunk for a 57-39 lead with 15:31 left. Yale (1-6) never came closer than five the rest of the way. Eric Flato led the Bulldogs with a career-high 23 points. Casey Hughes added 12 and Sam Kaplan 11. Sacred Heart held Yale to one basket in the final 12:10 of the first half and held a 40-31 lead at the break.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
